title: Custom Icons on Folder/Connection
author: stevealexandre
body_snippet:
|Operating system | Windows 7 x64 |
|mRemoteNG version| 1.75.7008.17935  |

Can you add the feature to add custom icons and the possibility to put icon on Folders too ?
It will be great to see the difference between environment(production, bench, etc...)

Example on an another tool :
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21204359/28273528-ee648d4e-6b0e-11e7-9693-49dcf5c6b6de.png)

iterations.description: Popular feature request with multiple +1s for custom icons on folders/connections, with a good suggestion to store icons in the connection file or %LocalAppData% instead of requiring admin access to Program Files

comments.author: Fiiti
comments.snippet: +1 A very missing feature for me also.

comments.author: gdsotirov
comments.snippet: +1 Would be especially useful with large connection lists like mine, which is constantly growing. :-)

I don't know since when, but connection icons can be customized. I can't see a way to do folder icons, though. 
Just drop the custom icons into the `..\mRemoteNG\icons` folder. That makes them available in the custom icons list. (running 1.76.8.17214).

comments.author: dboc
comments.snippet: Cool! But i need to change folder icons.

comments.author: gdsotirov
comments.snippet: Yes, dropping icons to `mRemoteNG\icons` works and I use it, but it would be nice to be able to customize folder icons as well especially if one has many connections.

comments.author: Zewwy
comments.snippet: Whens this becoming a thing? I was just about to open an Issue ticket and saw this one open. :D

comments.author: Greycat01
comments.snippet: Does adding custom icons create an issue when those icons aren't present in a new location? Say after export/import

comments.author: peterj04
comments.snippet:
> Does adding custom icons create an issue when those icons aren't present in a new location? Say after export/import

What I've noticed is that the connection remains intact, but the icon is gone until I add the custom icons back to the icons folder, so I always make a backup of my custom icons just in case I need to reinstall.

comments.author: Anders-Ryden
comments.snippet:
+1
Folder icons would be really useful

comments.author: noz482
comments.snippet:
The ability to use custom icons for folders would help me out a ton. +1

Thanks for the great application. Makes my role as a lab admin much easier.

comments.author: itb-dev-bw
comments.snippet:
I also would like to have an easier way of setting custom connection icons! +1

Also, I'm missing a way to use custom icons that **doesn't need administrator access** to write into Program Files. Better to use %LocalAppData% or save icons directly into the connection file (like KeePass does it).

notes:
AI triage: Popular feature request with multiple +1s for custom icons on folders/connections, with a good suggestion to store icons in the connection file or %LocalAppData% instead of requiring admin access to Program Files
Approach: Add a CustomIconPath property to ConnectionInfo, allow embedding base64-encoded icons in the connection XML file (similar to KeePass), and provide a UI to browse/select custom icons from %LocalAppData%\mRemoteNG\Icons without requiring admin privileges
